intro: Galium pallens, commonly known as pale bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers, which bloom in the summer months. Galium pallens is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is a perennial herb that spreads through rhizomes, forming dense mats in suitable habitats.
